intro: Aspicarpa argentea, commonly known as silverleaf aspicarpa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are often covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving it a distinctive appearance. Aspicarpa argentea is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
